title: Your Name: A Tale of Fate and Love

characters.name: Taki Tachibana
characters.appearance: A 17-year-old boy with short, messy black hair, wearing a high school uniform consisting of a white shirt, black blazer, and gray trousers. He has sharp, expressive eyes and a lean build.
characters.appearance_prompt: A Japanese high school boy with short black hair, wearing a white shirt, black blazer, and gray trousers. Sharp, expressive eyes, lean build, standing confidently in an urban setting.
characters.background: Taki is a high school student living in Tokyo. He works part-time at an Italian restaurant and has a passion for architecture. He is practical and determined, but often feels disconnected from his surroundings until he starts swapping bodies with Mitsuha.

characters.name: Mitsuha Miyamizu
characters.appearance: A 17-year-old girl with long, dark brown hair tied in a red ribbon, wearing her school uniform: a white blouse, green pleated skirt, and red ribbon. She has gentle, kind eyes and a petite frame.
characters.appearance_prompt: A Japanese high school girl with long dark brown hair tied in a red ribbon, wearing a white blouse and green pleated skirt. Gentle, kind eyes, petite frame, standing in a rural setting with mountains in the background.
characters.background: Mitsuha is a high school girl living in the rural town of Itomori. She helps her family run a shrine and often feels stifled by the small-town life. She dreams of living in Tokyo and experiencing the excitement of the city.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki wakes up in his small Tokyo apartment, feeling disoriented. The morning light filters through the curtains, and the sounds of the bustling city outside fill the air.
nodes.imagePrompt: A small, cluttered Tokyo apartment with morning light filtering through curtains. A teenage boy with short black hair sits on a bed, looking confused. The room is filled with posters and sketches of buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: What... what happened last night? Why do I feel so strange?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: My head feels heavy, like I’ve been dreaming for hours, but I can’t remember a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: And why does my room feel... different? Like it’s not entirely mine.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I need to shake this off. Maybe some water will help.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But... why does my reflection in the mirror look so unfamiliar?

choices.text: Go to school and see if anything feels off

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki picks up his phone and notices a strange note in his notes app. It's written in a handwriting he doesn't recognize, detailing events he doesn't remember.
nodes.imagePrompt: A close-up of a smartphone screen showing a handwritten note in a neat, feminine script. The room is dimly lit, with the phone's glow illuminating Taki's confused expression.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Who wrote this? This isn’t my handwriting... Did someone break into my phone?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Wait, this note... it’s about my day, but I don’t remember doing any of this.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Did I sleepwalk? Or... is this some kind of prank?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No, it’s too detailed. Someone was in my body. But how?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I need to figure this out. This can’t be real... can it?

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki arrives at school, feeling out of place. His friends notice his strange behavior and ask if he's feeling okay.
nodes.imagePrompt: A bustling high school hallway in Tokyo. Taki stands awkwardly, surrounded by curious classmates. The hallway is filled with students in uniforms, and sunlight streams through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Friend
dialogues.text: Hey, Taki, you look like you’ve seen a ghost. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know. Something feels really off today.

dialogues.speaker: Friend
dialogues.text: You’ve been spacing out all morning. Did you pull an all-nighter or something?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No, it’s not that. It’s like... I’m not entirely myself.

dialogues.speaker: Friend
dialogues.text: Well, you’re acting weird, that’s for sure. Maybe you’re coming down with something.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Maybe... but it feels deeper than that. Like something’s missing.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki returns home, still confused. He decides to leave a note for the mysterious person who seems to be sharing his body.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki sitting at his desk in his apartment, writing a note by lamplight. The room is quiet, with the city lights visible through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: If you’re really out there, who are you? And why is this happening?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I don’t even know if you’ll see this, but... I need answers.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: You’ve been living my life, haven’t you? Taking over my body?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you’re real or if I’m going crazy, but... please, tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Anything. Just... let me know I’m not alone in this.

nodes.sceneDescription: The next morning, Taki wakes up to find a reply to his note. The handwriting is different, and the message is from Mitsuha.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki's desk with a handwritten note in a different script. The morning light streams through the window, casting a warm glow on the paper.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I’m Mitsuha. I don’t know why this is happening either, but I think we’re swapping bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: It’s been happening to me too. I wake up in your body, in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: At first, I thought it was a dream, but it’s too real. Too vivid.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to explain it, but... I think we’re connected somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: Please, tell me you’re real. Tell me I’m not imagining all of this.

choices.text: Try to figure out how to control the swaps

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki and Mitsuha begin exchanging notes, learning about each other's lives. Taki is fascinated by Mitsuha's rural town and her role in the shrine.
nodes.imagePrompt: A series of handwritten notes spread across a desk, showing a conversation between Taki and Mitsuha. The room is cozy, with a warm lamp lighting the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Your town sounds so different from Tokyo. What’s it like living there?

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: It’s quiet, but sometimes it feels like I’m trapped. I wish I could see the city.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Trapped? But it sounds peaceful. Tokyo is so loud, so crowded. It’s exhausting.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I guess the grass is always greener, huh? I’d give anything to see the skyline, the lights...

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: And I’d give anything to see the stars. Here, the city lights drown them out.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: Maybe... we’re both looking for something we don’t have.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki tries to find a way to control the body swaps, experimenting with different methods like meditation and writing down his thoughts.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki sitting cross-legged on his bed, eyes closed, trying to meditate. The room is dimly lit, with a notebook open beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Maybe if I focus hard enough, I can control when we switch...

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: There has to be a pattern, a trigger. Something that makes this happen.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: If I can figure it out, maybe we can stop it. Or at least make it less... chaotic.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But how? It’s not like there’s a manual for this kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I’ll try meditating. Maybe clearing my mind will help me understand.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki and Mitsuha continue to swap bodies, growing closer as they navigate each other's lives. They start leaving detailed notes to help each other.
nodes.imagePrompt: A montage of scenes showing Taki and Mitsuha living each other's lives: Taki in Mitsuha's rural town, Mitsuha in Tokyo. The transitions are seamless, with a dreamlike quality.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: Your friends are so different from mine. It’s kind of fun being you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: And your family... they’re so warm. I wish I had that.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: Really? I always thought my family was too traditional, too... suffocating.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: At least they care. My dad’s always working, and my mom... well, she’s not around.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I guess we both have things we’re running from, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Yeah. But maybe... we’re also running toward something. Together.

nodes.sceneDescription: One day, Taki wakes up and realizes the swaps have stopped. He feels a deep sense of loss and decides to find Mitsuha.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki standing in his apartment, looking out the window at the city skyline. His expression is one of longing and determination.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Mitsuha... where are you? I need to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: It’s been days since the last swap. I feel... empty without you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I don’t even know where to start looking, but I can’t just sit here.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: You’re out there somewhere. I know it. And I’m going to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No matter how far I have to go, no matter what it takes.

choices.text: Travel to Itomori to find her

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki searches online for Mitsuha but finds no trace of her. He begins to suspect something is wrong.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki sitting at his computer, scrolling through search results. The screen glows in the dark room, casting shadows on his worried face.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Why can’t I find anything about her? It’s like she doesn’t exist...

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I’ve searched everywhere—social media, news articles, even old records. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But she’s real. I know she is. I’ve lived her life, felt her memories.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: There has to be something I’m missing. Some clue I haven’t found yet.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I won’t give up. I can’t. Not until I find her.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki travels to Itomori, only to find the town in ruins. He learns that it was destroyed by a comet three years ago.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki standing in the ruins of Itomori, surrounded by debris and overgrown vegetation. The sky is overcast, adding to the somber atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No... this can’t be real. Mitsuha... she was here. She was real.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: The town... it’s gone. Destroyed. How could this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I remember her talking about the comet, but... I didn’t think it would end like this.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: She’s gone. And I... I never got to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But... there has to be a way. I can’t accept this. I won’t.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki discovers that Mitsuha's spirit is still connected to him through the body swaps. He resolves to travel back in time to save her.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki standing in a mystical shrine, surrounded by glowing symbols. The atmosphere is otherworldly, with a sense of urgency in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I have to save her. No matter what it takes, I have to change the past.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: If I can go back, if I can warn her... maybe I can stop this from happening.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But how? Time travel... it’s impossible. Isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No. I can’t think like that. If there’s even a chance, I have to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Mitsuha... I’m coming for you. Just hold on.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki succeeds in altering the past, saving Mitsuha and her town. However, the changes cause both of them to lose their memories of each other.
nodes.imagePrompt: A surreal scene of time rewinding, with Taki and Mitsuha fading from each other's memories. The background is a mix of past and present, with a dreamlike quality.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: The timeline shifts, and the memories of their connection fade away. But somewhere deep inside, a bond remains.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: The comet passes harmlessly, and the town of Itomori is saved. But the cost is high.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: Taki and Mitsuha no longer remember each other. Their shared moments, their struggles, their love... all gone.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: Yet, in their hearts, a faint echo lingers. A whisper of something lost, something precious.

dialogues.speaker: Narrator
dialogues.text: And though they don’t know it yet, their paths will cross again.

nodes.sceneDescription: Years later, Taki and Mitsuha cross paths in Tokyo. They feel a strange sense of déjà vu but can't place why.
nodes.imagePrompt: A busy Tokyo street at sunset. Taki and Mitsuha pass each other, their eyes meeting briefly. The city lights create a warm, nostalgic atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Have we... met before?

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I feel like I know you from somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Your face... it’s familiar. Like I’ve seen it in a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: Me too. It’s strange, but... I feel like I’ve been waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Maybe... we have. Maybe we were meant to find each other.

choices.text: Introduce yourself and see if she remembers
Walk away, feeling it's just a coincidence

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki and Mitsuha start talking, and slowly, fragments of their memories return. They realize the depth of their connection.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki and Mitsuha sitting on a park bench, talking under the soft glow of streetlights. The atmosphere is warm and intimate, with a sense of rediscovery.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: It’s you... it’s really you. I’ve been looking for you all this time.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: And I’ve been waiting for you. I just didn’t know it until now.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: The memories... they’re coming back. The swaps, the notes, everything.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: I remember too. The town, the comet... you saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No, we saved each other. And this time, I won’t let you go.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki walks away, but the sense of déjà vu lingers. He feels a deep sadness, as if he's lost something important.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki walking alone down a Tokyo street at night, his expression pensive. The city lights blur in the background, creating a melancholic atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Why does it feel like I’ve lost something... someone?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: That girl... her face keeps haunting me. Like I’m supposed to remember her.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: But every time I try to grasp it, the memory slips away.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: It’s like a part of me is missing, and I don’t know how to fill the void.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I need to find her. I need to know who she is.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki and Mitsuha reunite fully, their memories restored. They embrace, knowing their bond transcends time and space.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki and Mitsuha embracing under a starry sky, their faces filled with joy and relief. The scene is bathed in soft, ethereal light.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: We found each other again. This time, I won’t let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: And I’ll always be here, waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: No matter what happens, no matter how far apart we are, I’ll always find you.

dialogues.speaker: Mitsuha
dialogues.text: And I’ll always remember you. Even if the world forgets, I won’t.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: This is our second chance. Let’s make it count.

nodes.sceneDescription: Taki continues his life in Tokyo, but the memory of Mitsuha haunts him. He feels an inexplicable void in his heart.
nodes.imagePrompt: Taki sitting alone in his apartment, staring out the window at the city lights. His expression is one of longing and unresolved emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Why does it feel like I’m missing a part of myself?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: Even though I’m back in Tokyo, back to my normal life, something feels... off.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: It’s like there’s a hole in my heart, and I don’t know how to fill it.

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I keep dreaming of a girl with long hair and a red ribbon. Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: Taki
dialogues.text: I need to find her. I need to know why she feels so important.
